Seadra.overview:
• After an Agility boost, Seadra outspeeds everything in the entire metagame
  • Really strong and in the off-chance you get a crit, it'll do a lot of damage
  • Faces competition from Frogadier and other offensive Water-types
  • Relies on getting a boost from Agility to get around threats, so it can be left vulnerable
  • Flimsy bulk makes setting up difficult
Seadra.comments:
Other Options

  • Dragon Dance enables Seadra to boost its Attack and Speed stats, but such an option is better left to Fraxure or Dragonair
  • Focus Energy with a Scope Lens can be used to take advantage of Critical Hits, but is an unreliable strategy
  • Scald is always a good move and has some defensive utility when it burns foes, but is significantly weaker than Hydro Pump
  • Clear Smog is an interesting option if you're worried about things setting up on Seadra

Checks and Counters

Porygon2: Porygon2's special bulk allows it to shrug off repeated Hydro Pumps, and Thunderbolt will do massive damage in return to Seadra

Roselia: Roselia is bulky enough to take on an Ice Beam and can then put Seadra to sleep with Sleep Powder

Generally powerful threats: Because Seadra has little to no bulk, powerful attacks from Piloswine, Electabuzz, Fletchinder, or Fraxure threaten to OHKO Seadra before it sets up

Generally bulky threats: Prinplup, Lombre, Sealeo, and Clefairy are all capable of stomaching hits from Seadra and can threaten back with phazing, status, or STAB moves

sets.name: Agility
sets.description:
Moves

  • Agility lets Seadra outspeed everything in the metagame after a single boost
  • Hydro pump is powerful STAB that allows Seadra to blow past most threats in Middle Cup
  • Ice Beam hits Dragon- and Grass-types that otherwise resist Hydro Pump
  • Hidden Power Grass is for opposing Water-types that would otherwise wall Kingdra

Set Details

  • The key to this set is power: Life Orb and a Modest nature crank Seadra's power to the maximum since Agility takes care of its Speed
  • Sniper shouldn't be relied upon, but in the event of a Critical Hit it's a nice tool that boosts the output

Usage Tips

  • Save agility for late game when you can just click Hydro Pump to clean up
  • However, Hydro Pump can be used early on to weaken opposing threats
  • Weaken things with teammates and entry hazards so it's easier to sweep with Seadra
  • Seadra needs to watch out and not take any hits since it's not bulky: use teammates with U-turn to help get it in safely

Team Options

  • Bring along fletchinder to remove Grass-types
  • At the same time, bring your own Grass-types; Quilladin is nice to weaken Water-types and set Spikes
  • Golbat is a good partner to remove entry hazards, but will require a Ground-type or other Electric-type switch in to go with it

Electabuzz.overview:
• Fastest unboosted Pokemon in the metagame
  • Speed and movepool make it one of the biggest offensive threats
  • Volt Switch and reliance on Choice items make it a fantastic pivot
  • Physical bulk is lacking and is commonly 2HKOed by resisted hits
Electabuzz.comments:
Other Options

  • A Choice Scarf can be used to outspeed all other Choice Scarf users and most +2 Speed threats, but Electabuzz lacks the immediate power to make full use of it
  • Charge Beam can be used over Volt Switch in hopes of accumulating Special Attack boosts. However this prevents Electabuzz from pivoting and Charge Beam is weak and not always guaranteed to result in a boost
  • Electabuzz has a decent supporting movepool, with access to Reflect, Light Screen, and Thunder Wave, and could pull off a Dual Screens set with moderate ease. A lack of its own entry hazards limits its viability however
  • Cross Chop will outdamage Focus Blast against Porygon2 but is rather useless against other targets

Checks and Counters

Faster threats: Threats like Choice Scarf Krokorok and Choice Scarf Staravia can outspeed most Electabuzz variants and punish its lower Defense stat through powerful STAB attacks

Curse Sliggoo: Arguably the best counter to Electabuzz, as any Curse boosts will nullify the Ice Punch damage after a few boosts

Priority: A slightly weakened Electabuzz is exceedingly vulnerable to unboosted priority attacks like Shadow Sneak, Aqua Jet, or Mach Punch

Special Tanks Without Focus Blast or Ice Punch, threats like Porygon2 and Sliggoo become a massive nuisance to any Electabuzz set, as it is incapable of 3HKOing either opponent and will be worn down by recoil and weak attacks

sets.name: Offensive Pivot
sets.description:
Moves

  • Thunderbolt is powerful STAB, frying the majority of the tier
  • Focus Blast enables Electabuzz to hit Piloswine and Rhydon, who are immune to Thunderbolt. Good for other Electric-types and 2HKOing Porygon2
  • Because Piloswine is only 2HKOed by Focus Blast, Hidden Power Grass can be used to ensure the OHKO on Rhydon while giving Electabuzz a way to remove Marshtomp
  • Ice Punch hits Dragon- or Grass-types such as Sliggoo and Roselia for super effective damage
  • Volt Switch allows Electabuzz to pivot to another teammate while doing steady damage

Set Details

  • Going mixed prevents things like Roseila and Sliggoo from walling Electabuzz
  • A Life Orb helps boost the output of Electabuzz's attacks, but Choice Specs can be used instead to turn it into a nightmare wallbreaker
  • Maintaining a positive Speed nature retains Electabuzz as the fastest unboosted Pokemon in the metagame
  • Alternatively, Timid without the investment in Attack can be ran with Psychic since Electabuzz doesn't appreciate having its Defense lowered. If this is the case, Electabuzz can still 2HKO Roselia, but Sliggoo will wall Electabuzz

Usage Tips

  • Electabuzz works great serving as a revenge killer thanks to its Speed tier
  • Electabuzz can safely switch in on weaker special attacks from defensive threats like Prinplup or Togetic
  • Prefers having some Pokemon weakened, specifically Piloswine
  • Walled cold by Porygon2 and Sliggoo if it lacks Focus Blast and Ice Punch

Team Options

  • Entry hazard support really helps Electabuzz; it forces a lot of switches and just barely misses out on a lot of OHKOs
  • Appreciates having Choice Scarf and other Speed-boosting threats removed. Swords Dance Croconaw and Fletchinder can use powerful priority attacks to remove such threats to Electabuzz
  • Wallbreakers to help get through Piloswine, Porygon2, and Sliggoo are appreciated. Gurdurr pairs well with Electabuzz for this reason

Magmar.overview:
• One of the most powerful mixed attackers in the meta, with very good offensive stats
  • Has a very good 93 Speed stat, letting it outpace Pokemon like Monferno
  • Is frail on the physical side, and doesn't have a very good defensive typing either
  • Lacks a secondary STAB like Monferno, making it sometimes outclassed by Monferno on some teams
  • Is walled by one of the most popular Pokemon, Sliggoo
  • Can be revenged by Choice Scarf Pokemon and Frogadier and Electabuzz
Magmar.comments:
Other Options

  • A physically oriented set with Flare Blitz and Cross Chop can be used to use Magmar's decent 95 Attack stat, but it isn't as powerful and doesn't have as much coverage as the specially-based set
  • Choice Scarf can be used to make Magmar a powerful revenge killer, but it is best used as a wallbreaker
  • Hidden Power Ice can be used over Hidden Power Grass to hit Sliggoo and Ground-types, but cannot hit Water-types like Hidden Power Grass can
  • Substitute and Belly Drum in tandem with Mach Punch is a neat idea, but very hard to pull off due to Magmar's Speed tier and Stealth Rock weakness

Checks and Counters

Sliggoo: Sliggoo is the best check to Magmar around, as it can easily takes all of Magmar's attacks, and Rest variants can heal off the damage and set up Curses in front of Magmar, while offensive variants can cripple Magmar with a powerful Draco Meteor. However, non-Rest variants are prone to getting worn down by repeated switchins, and it straight-up loses to Belly Drum variants.

Revenge Killers: Frogadier and Electabuzz can outspeed Magmar and revenge kill it with their powerful attacks, but they cannot switch in. The same goes for Fletchinder and Choice Scarf Pokemon like Monferno.

Ground-types: While they usually cannot take a Focus Blast very well, Ground-types like Gabite and Vibrava can take a Fire Blast and fire back with their STAB. Gabite can also use a Choice Scarf to revenge kill Magmar.

sets.name: Life Orb Attacker
sets.description:
Moves

  • Fire Blast is Magmar's main STAB move, hitting neutral targets very hard and also provides coverage on Grass and Ice-types
  • Focus Blast 2HKOs Porygon2, who is a decent check to Magmar otherwise, and also hits Rock-types like Lairon
  • Hidden Power Grass hits Water-types like Prinplup for good damage, and also hits Ground-types like Rhydon and Marshtomp
  • Mach Punch is the preferred option in the last slot as it lets Magmar pick off faster weakened threats
  • Alternatively, Sunny Day is an option to make Fire Blast even more powerful, 2HKOing a lot of threats it normally 3HKOed, but it requires a turn to set up

Set Details

  • Maximum Special Attack and Speed investment maximizes Magmar's offensive potential
  • Life Orb is chosen as the item to increase Magmar's power
  • A Hasty Nature should be used with Mach Punch to preserve it's decent power, but a Timid Nature should be used with Sunny Day as Magmar then has no physical moves to use
  • Vital Spirit is chosen as the ability to absorb Roselia's Sleep Powder, giving Magmar a free switch in

Usage Tips

  • Magmar is rather frail, so only bring it in on resisted attacks or on a Sleep Powder from Roselia, as Vital Spirit makes it immune to sleep
  • Magmar should be played as a wallbreaker or as a late-game cleaner with his speed and power

Team Options

  • An answer to Sliggoo is required for Magmar, as it otherwise can switch into it easily, so Pokemon like Piloswine and Clefairy can make for good partners
  • Ways of bringing in Magmar safely, such as Volt Switch from Electabuzz, U-Turn from Vibrava, or Baton Pass from Togetic are good as Magmar's lackluster bulk means it cannot switch in safely on many attacks
  • Checks to Water-types and Rock-types like Grotle are appreciated as Magmar is weak to those types

Croconaw.overview:
• Sheer Force makes Croconaw a threatening boosting sweeper
  • Being able to set up with Dragon Dance or Swords Dance allows Croconaw to beat bulky and offensive teams
  • Respectable bulk lets it set up relatively easy
  • Unfortunate speed tier leaves Croconaw needing two Dragon Dance boosts to outspeed all relevant Choice Scarf threats
Croconaw.comments:
Other Options

  • Croconaw doesn't have a ton of other options at its disposal and is really limited to the above two sets.
  • Facade has a limited use for absorbing any stray burns, but those are exceedingly rare in Middle Cup
  • Hone Claws is inferior to Swords Dance, as Croconaw has no useful low accuracy moves to take advantage of
  • Choice Band is inferior to the Life Orb sets, and Croconaw is too slow to utilize a Choice Scarf

Checks and Counters

Thunder Wave: The safest and easiest way to beat Croconaw is to permanently slow it down; the lack of priority on the Dragon Dance set makes paralysis a death sentence while the Swords Dance set hates being paralyzed too

Togetic: Physically defensive Togetic is only 2HKOed by boosted Jolly Croconaw; Waterfall or Ice Punch are only 2HKOs. Togetic also tends to carry Thunder Wave and is capable of roosting off damage, but won't be able to stall out Croconaw

Electabuzz: Choice Scarf variants will outspeed +2 Jolly Croconaw and all variants of Electabuzz barely survive a +2 Aqua Jet while instantly threatening back with Volt Switch or Thunderbolt.

Priority: A weakened, set up Croconaw will be threatened by powerful priority users like Fletchinder or Gurdurr

sets.name: Dragon Dance Sweeper
sets.description:
Moves

  • Dragon Dance boosts both Attack and Speed making Croconaw a massive threat for offensive teams
  • Waterfall is Sheer Force-boosted STAB that OHKOs a lot of Pokemon in Middle Cup after a boost
  • Crunch is also boosted by Sheer Force, and demolishes Ghost- and Psychic-type opponents
  • Ice Punch, another attack boosted by Sheer Force, gives Croconaw a way to bypass Togetic and Grass-type switch-ins
  • Because Croconaw is still rather slow after a single Dragon Dance, Aqua Jet can be used to pick off faster, frail, and possibly weakened threats that may prevent a sweep

Set Details

  • Jolly nature is a must, as Adamant Croconaw is still outsped by Electabuzz after a Dragon Dance boost
  • EV spread maximizes Attack and Speed
  • Life Orb capitalizes on Sheer Force, as the recoil is negated and helps strengthen Croconaw's attacks

Usage Tips

  • Bring Croconaw in on passive Pokemon that don't threaten it or on Choice-locked Water- or Fire-type attacks to snag a boost and being sweeping
  • Croconaw needs two boosts to outspeed all relevant Choice Scarf threats, so be prepared to have to click Dragon Dance twice in order to sweep
  • Even with Ice Punch, +1 Croconaw will only 2HKO max Defense Togetic so make sure its worn down before beginning a sweep

Team Options

  • Entry hazard support from Whirlipede or Rhydon is recommended, helping break walls that try to stymie a Croconaw sweep
  • U-turn and Volt Switch provide Croconaw ample opportunities to set up
  • Thunder Wave support or other forms of speed control are recommended, as Choice Scarf users are a huge pain for Croconaw

sets.name: Swords Dance Sweeper
sets.description:
Moves

  • Swords Dance boosts Croconaw's Attack to very scary levels; most switch-ins are OHKOed after Stealth Rock damage
  • Waterfall is Sheer Force-boosted STAB that provides solid coverage in Middle Cup
  • Crunch is also boosted by Sheer Force and when in tandem with Waterfall has near perfect neutral coverage, only missing out on Zweilous
  • Aqua Jet allows Croconaw to pick off faster threats and does a lot after a Swords Dance boost

Set Details

  • Jolly nature isn't as mandatory on this set as it is for the Dragon Dance set, so Adamant can be used to shred the opposition. Being able to outspeed Timid Gothorita is nice though, since it OHKOs back with Thunderbolt and Aqua Jet is a 2HKO
  • EVs are standard for maximizing Attack and Speed. A bulkier spread could be employed with Substitute, but Croconaw prefers being able to snipe faster opposition with Aqua Jet

Usage Tips

  • Excels in late-game scenarios when faster or bulkier threats have been removed or critically weakened
  • Sets up on a fair bit of opposing walls since only a single boost is needed
  • Do not use Swords Dance Croconaw during the early stages of a game unless it is fully capable of cleaning out the opposition. Croconaw absolutely needs faster threats capable of surviving a +2 Aqua Jet removed

Team Options

  • Thunder Wave support makes Swords Dance Croconaw all the more dangerous, as fast opposition can no longer offensively check it. Porygon2 is excellent in such a role, as it switches in on a lot of fast threats for free
  • Entry hazard support makes switching in on Croconaw nearly impossible. After Stealth Rock, via Rhydon, or Spikes via Whirlipede, a lot of its 2HKOs turn into OHKOs
  • Pivots capable of bringing Croconaw in on Fire- or Ground-types are excellent partners, giving Croconaw a free turn to use Swords Dance

Togetic.overview:
• A great physically defensive wall with superb typing, Togetic is a great check to Pokemon like Gurdurr
  • With moves like Defog and Heal Bell, Togetic is also one of the best support Pokemon in the tier
  • Only Pokemon in Middle Cup with access to Baton Pass
  • Can be worn down by repeated switch-ins and a weakness to Stealth Rock
  • Can be lured by sets like Heavy Slam Machoke and Swords Dance + Poison Jab Fraxure, making it sometimes a lesser check to these Pokemon
  • Is weak to some common types in the metagame, such as Steel and Electric
Togetic.comments:
Other Options

  • Wish can be used over Roost, as it has utility in healing up a teammate, but it takes 2 turns to heal up Togetic, and Togetic's Wishes aren't necessarily very big
  • Baton Pass can be used on the defensive set to gain momentum on switches and also pivot into a teammate effectively due to Togetic's low Speed

Checks and Counters

Electric-types: Electric-types, such as Electabuzz and Luxio, are great checks to Togetic, as they are immune to Thunder Wave, take little from Dazzling Gleam, and can hit it super effectively with their STAB moves

Ice-types: While a rare commodity in Middle Cup, Ice-types such as Piloswine and Sealeo are good checks to Togetic, as they hit it super effectively with their STAB moves and can even set up with moves like Substitute and Stealth Rock

Steel-types: Steel-types resist Dazzling Gleam, and while they must be wary of Thunder Wave and Fire Blast, they can still set up on Togetic and hit it for big damage with their STAB moves

Powerful Special Attackers: While Togetic's Special Defense is not bad at all, without investment, Togetic can become vulnerable to powerful special attackers like Electabuzz and Seadra

sets.name: Defensive Defogger
sets.description:
Moves

  • Defog is used to remove hazards and support hazard-weak teammates
  • Roost is essential for reliable recovery, making Togetic a more reliable wall to the attackers it should check
  • Dazzling Gleam is STAB, hitting Dragon-, Dark-, and Fighting-types super effectively
  • Heal Bell can be used to make Togetic into a cleric, removing status and further supporting its team
  • Thunder Wave is also an option to cripple switch-ins like Golbat and set-up sweepers like Dragon Dance Fraxure

Set Details

  • Max HP and Defense investment with a Bold Nature make Togetic as physically bulky as possible
  • Serene Grace is used, as Super Luck is incompatible with Defog
  • A specially defensive spread with a Calm Nature can be used to make Togetic a better check to Pokemon like Sliggoo; however, Togetic's typing makes it a better physical than special wall

Usage Tips

  • Togetic can essentially be absentmindedly thrown at the Pokemon it checks, such as Fraxure and Gurdurr
  • It can then either Defog hazards away, Roost if it's taken some damage, attack, or use other supporting moves

Team Options

  • Porygon2 helps form an excellent defensive core with Togetic, because both of them are good defensive Pokemon and Porygon2 appreciates Togetic checking Fighting-types, while Togetic enjoys Porygon2 checking most special attackers
  • Checks to Electric-types such as Piloswine can also appreciate Togetic checking Fighting-types and most other physical attackers
  • Ice-type checks like Prinplup and Seadra help Togetic with its weakness to Ice moves
  • Slower Pokemon that appreciate Thunder Wave support from Togetic such as Rhydon are good partners for Togetic

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description:
Moves

  • Nasty Plot is used to boost Togetic's Special Attack so it can then Baton Pass the boosts to another teammate that can put them to better use
  • Dazzling Gleam hits Dark-, Dragon-, and Fighting-types for good damage and is a reliable STAB attack that can be boosted by Nasty Plot
  • Roost is used for reliable recovery
  • Baton Pass is used to pass Nasty Plot boosts and can also be used to pivot into a teammate to gain momentum
  • If Togetic is used as a sweeper however, Fire Blast helps round out coverage vs Steel-types that would normally switch in on Dazzling Gleam

Set Details

  • Investing in Speed is not at all recommended, since Togetic will still be outpaced by all other Speed-investing sweepers
  • Instead, maximizing HP and Defense investment makes Togetic a great check to Pokemon like Gurdurr and Dragonair, and allows it to set up on weaker physical threats
  • If Fire Blast is ran instead of Baton Pass, allocate the EVs in Defense to Special Attack
  • Another EV spread is to make Togetic as slow as possible with a Relaxed Nature; this makes its Baton Passes extremely slow, ensuring that the recipient will not be damaged upon switching in

Usage Tips

  • Switch Togetic into the Pokemon it checks, such as Dragonair and Gurdurr, and proceed to boost with Nasty Plot
  • Once you're set up, you can Baton Pass those boosts to another teammate, making them extremely strong, or proceed to break the opponent

Team Options

  • Recipients that can abuse the boosts Togetic passes, such as Electabuzz, Frogadier, and even offensive Porygon2, make for great partners to this set
  • Hazard removal of your own is appreciated so Togetic isn't stripped of 25% of its health when switching into Stealth Rock
  • As with the defensive set, checks to Electric-types, such as Gabite and Piloswine, and checks to Ice-types, like Monferno, make for good partners
  • Checks to Poison-types like Duosion are also helpful, as Togetic struggles with those Pokemon

Marill.overview:
• Has an amazing ability in Huge Power, giving it good offensive presence
  • Has a great Water/Fairy typing, making it an excellent check to certain threats such as Monferno
  • Is slow, leaving it outsped by many offensive threats, although access to priority in Aqua Jet helps mitigate this problem
  • Faces competition from other offensive Water-types such as Frogadier and Croconaw
Marill.comments:
Other Options

  • An Assault Vest set can be used to give Marill better special bulk making it a better check to Pokemon like Sliggoo, but it sacrifices Marill's offensive prowess
  • A Belly Drum set can be used as Marill's access to priority in Aqua Jet make it an effective Belly Drum sweeper, especially with it's ability to force out threats like Magmar, but it's prone to being revenge killed by Aqua Jet resists and Fletchinder's presence make this set hard to use

Checks and Counters

Grass-types: Grass-types such as Roselia resist Marill's Water-type attacks and can hit Marill hard with their STAB moves, and Grass/Poison types like Gloom resist Marill's Fairy STAB as well. However, Ice Punch or even Knock Off can do a lot to them, and Roselia is 2HKOed by Play Rough and Waterfall as well

Faster Pokemon: The easiest way to get rid of Marill is through faster Pokemon such as Grovyle that take advantage of its low Speed and can take care of it with their powerful moves. However, some of them such as Electabuzz have to fear a Choice Band Aqua Jet if they are weakened

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
Moves

  • Play Rough is Marill's main STAB move, dealing massive damage to anything that doesn't resist it and hitting Dragon-, Fighting-, and Dark-types super effectively
  • Waterfall is Marill's secondary STAB attack, hitting Rock- and Ground-types for big damage
  • Aqua Jet is essential for Marill, making it a decent revenge killer and helping with its low Speed
  • Ice Punch is preferred in the last slot to hit Grass-types hard; it OHKOes Roselia and 2HKOes Quilladin and Gloom
  • Knock Off is an option over Ice Punch that takes off the opponent's item, has good neutral coverage, and is Marill's best way of hitting Metang and Doublade
  • Superpower can be used as well to hit Normal-types, mainly Porygon2, for big damage

Set Details

  • The given EV spread makes Marill outspeed uninvested Roselia
  • Maximum Attack investment with an Adamant Nature make Marill as powerful as possible, especially with a Choice Band equipped
  • Huge Power is chosen as the ability to give Marill a massive power boost, making it a powerful wallbreaker

Usage Tips

  • Marill's good typing and decent bulk make it a good offensive switch-in to Pokemon such as Monferno and Gurdurr
  • Once Marill is in, spam its STAB moves or coverage to hit the opposing Pokemon as hard as it can
  • Aqua Jet is good for picking off weakened threats as well, so Marill can be used as a revenge killer

Team Options

  • VoltTurn users such as Electabuzz and Frogadier can get Marill in safely, and they appreciate Marill breaking through walls
  • Faster Pokemon that can make up for Marill's low Speed, such as Electabuzz, are good partners
  • Trick Room teams appreciate Marill's wallbreaking capabilities and, with Marill's low Speed, it can make full use of its bulk, so partners like Duosion fit well

Piloswine.overview:
• Phenomenal offensive typing
  • Extremely difficult to counter
  • High Attack and great physical bulk
  • Access to Stealth Rock
  • Poor defensive typing and low Speed makes it relatively easy to check
Piloswine.comments:
Other Options

  • Freeze-Dry is an option, but Earthquake does more damage to virtually every Water-type in the metagame
  • Choice Band can be run to boost Piloswine's Attack to immense levels, but the combination of its STAB attacks is a large part of what makes it so threatening

Checks and Counters

Seadra: 188 HP / 252 Def / 68 SpA Modest Seadra with Hydro Pump is the only Pokemon in the metagame that will counter Piloswine at full health.

Faster Water-types: Frogadier, Croconaw, and the like can quite easily outspeed and OHKO Piloswine while taking little damage from Ice Shard.

Super Effective Coverage: Focus Blast Electabuzz and Aqua Tail Fraxure can lure and OHKO Piloswine.

sets.name: Offensive Rocker
sets.description:
Moves

  • Earthquake is Piloswine's most powerful STAB move
  • Icicle Crash gets near-perfect coverage with Earthquake
  • Ice Shard is a powerful priority attack backed by Piloswine's high Attack
  • Stealth Rock gives Mamoswine very important utility
  • Superpower can also be run to better hit threats like Porygon2 and other Piloswine

Set Details

  • Piloswine is slow, so the given nature and EVs maximize power and contribute to bulk
  • Life Orb adds to Piloswine's tremendous power
  • Thick Fat gives allows it to only take neutral damage from threatening Fire-type attacks

Usage Tips

  • Piloswine is nearly impossible to switch into, so do not be afraid to spam its powerful moves
  • Solid Defense allows it to switch in on neutral physical hits relatively well
  • However, be wary of taking too many hits in conjunction with Life Orb recoil
  • Attempt to cripple and weaken quicker threats so that Mamoswine can clean them up with Ice Shard

Team Options

  • Pokemon that can switch into and KO Frogadier, such as Lombre
  • Fighting-type counters such as Doublade
  • Offensive Grass- and Electric-types like Grovyle and Electabuzz that pressure Water-types

Porygon2.overview:
• Premier special tank of Middle Cup that comfortably walls most special attackers in the metagame
  • Great supporting movepool
  • Can surprisingly pull off an effective offensive set thanks to Download and access to Agility
  • Fits every playstyle because of how effective it is
  • Gets bulldozed by common physical attackers and hates being statused
  • Set-up bait for most hazard setters, specifically Whirlipede and Piloswine
Porygon2.comments:
Other Options

  • A purely physically-defensive spread could be used in favor of the specially defensive one, but it can't shut down Fighting-types and generally powerful threats like Rhydon
  • A mixed or physical set could be used with Attack boosts from Download but Porygon2 lacks physical movepool and is outclassed by many other physical attackers

Checks and Counters

Fighting-types: Gurdurr and Monferno threaten both variants of Porygon2 with their STAB attacks. Neither like switching in on the offensive set though

Physical Attackers: The best way to beat Porygon2 is to capitalize on its lower Defense stat, thus strong threats like Rhydon, Doublade, and Piloswine are capable of beating Porygon2 down

Toxic: Because Porygon2 cannot heal status conditions, Toxic will severely limit its staying power and prevent it from continuously walling a large number of threats

Trick: The defensive variant is completely crippled if Tricked a Choice Band or Scarf. Choice Specs can make it a bit of an issue to switch in on though

sets.name: Duck Tank
sets.description:
Moves

  • Recover keeps Porygon2's HP at sufficient levels, allowing it to wall special attackers throughout a match
  • Thunder Wave paralyses offensive threats and is great team support, while Toxic helps break down opposing walls. Choice is dependent on what Porygon2's teammates require
  • Ice Beam provides ideal coverage against common threats in Middle Cup, hitting Ground-, Grass-, and Dragon-type threats
  • Thunderbolt rounds out coverage with Ice Beam, allowing Porygon2 to hit everything in Middle Cup for neutral damage.
  • Discharge should only be used if Porygon2 opts for Toxic, otherwise run Thunderbolt
  • Tri Attack is an excellent STAB option but lacks the coverage offered by Ice Beam and Thunderbolt

Set Details

  • Given EV spread and nature optimizes Porygon2's wicked special bulk while naturally hitting a Leftovers number
  • A mixed EV spread of 252 HP / 92 Def / 164 SpD with a Calm nature maintains Porygon2's ability to wall things like Life Orb Frogadier while giving it enough physical bulk to survive a +1 Outrage from Fraxure after Stealth Rock damage

Usage Tips

  • Porygon2 switches in on almost every unboosted special attacker in Middle Cup with impunity, the only exception being Life Orb Electabuzz with Focus Blast
  • Try to limit how often Porygon2 is matched against physical attackers. Its natural bulk will allow it to stay in and fire off a Thunder Wave or an attack, but it shouldn't remain in on most physical threats for long
  • Alternate EV spread will struggle against most Choice Specs holders and Life Orb Electabuzz, so Porygon2 should be used to check these as opposed to countering them

Team Options

  • Physically defensive Togetic is Middle Cup's best switch in for most physically offensive threats, such as Gurdurr, Krokorok, and Fraxure, and forms an excellent defensive core with Porygon2
  • Slower threats like Swords Dance Croconaw or Doublade appreciate the support from Thunder Wave
  • On the other hand, Agility Seadra and Rock Polish Rhydon like having walls weakened with Toxic
  • Entry hazards support from Whirlipede or Piloswine are appreciated, as Porygon2 forces a lot of switches

sets.name: Mighty Duck
sets.description:
Moves

  • Agility boosts Porygon2's Speed to a point where only Choice Scarf Electabuzz, Frogadier, or other +2 Speed threats are capable of keeping pace with it
  • Tri Attack is a reliable STAB option, hitting the majority of Middle Cup for neutral damage
  • Shadow Ball hits a lot of stuff that Tri-Attack doesn't, specifically Lampent, Haunter, and Doublade, providing perfect neutral coverage with Tri Attack
  • Ice Beam rounds out coverage, targeting Ground-, Flying-, Grass-, or Dragon-type threats
  • Recover can be used in tandem with a Life Orb, but leaves Porygon2 situationaly vulnerable against Rhydon, Roselia, or Siggoo

Set Details

  • The given EV spread gives Porygon2 a Life Orb number, enough Speed to outpace everything up to and including Choice Scarf Krokorok and maximum Special Attack
  • The rest of the EVs are dumped into Special Defense for extra bulk
  • A Modest nature is optimal over a Timid nature since the extra power is mandatory and any extra bulk from running Timid doesn't effectively change much
  • Leftovers gives Porygon2 some staying power when setting up but Life Orb turns Porygon2 into a menacing threat

Usage Tips

  • Bring Porygon2 out against weaker threats that have low Special Defense, such as Marshtomp or weakened Rhydon and Doublade, snag an Agility boost whenever available, and proceed to wreck havoc
  • While there is a slight Special Defense investment, this Porygon2 variant can't wall repeated special attacks and should not be used as a tank
  • Gurdurr and Monferno need to be eliminated before Porygon2 can begin a sweep, as Mach Punch will remove Porygon2 before it can prove to be effective

Team Options

  • Threats to remove Gurdurr and Monferno, such as Shadow Tag Gothorita, Fletchinder, or Togetic, are essential to Porygon2's success
  • Whirlipede and other entry hazard layers make for great teammates as the chip damage helps Porygon2 bust through more defensive threats
  • Gurdurr makes for an excellent partner as it can threaten and remove opposing defensive Porygon2
  • Porygon2 will appreciate having something remove Choice Scarf Electabuzz and other faster threats, so Piloswine and other bulky and powerful Pokemon often pair well with Porygon2

Marshtomp.overview:
• Good switch-in to physical attackers such as Monferno
  • Has a very good defensive typing, giving it only one weakness and letting it check Electric- and Rock-types
  • Is very slow, making it a momentum suck at times
  • Lures with Hidden Power Grass can ruin Marshtomp's ability to check threats due to its crippling 4x weakness to Grass
  • Has no reliable recovery, making it prone to getting worn down
Marshtomp.comments:
Other Options

  • A RestTalk set can be used to give Marshtomp semi-reliable recovery, but it has massive 4MSS as it can't fit Stealth Rock and Marshtomp's two STAB attacks onto the same set
  • A Choice Band is plausible due to Marshtomp's decent Attack stat, but is mostly outclassed by other physical attackers such as Rhydon due to their better power

Checks and Counters

Grass-types: Grass-types are Marshtomp's biggest counters, as they can hit it 4x super effectively with their STAB moves and don't mind Scald or Earthquake. However, some of them, such as Roselia and Grovyle, must watch out for Ice Punch variants on the switch-in

Grass-type coverage: Pokemon such as Charmeleon and Electabuzz can carry Grass-type coverage such as Hidden Power Grass and hit Marshtomp hard on the switch-in, ruining Marshtomp's ability to check them

Wallbreakers: While Marshtomp has the ability to check unboosted threats like Fletchinder, it still has lots of trouble checking boosted sweepers like Swords Dance Monferno, especially with its lack of reliable recovery

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
Moves

  • Stealth Rock is essential for every team and Marshtomp is a good user of the move, as it forces a lot of Pokemon out
  • Scald is chosen over Waterfall for its burn chance, letting Marshtomp wear down checks such as Quilladin
  • Earthquake hits most neutral targets for solid damage and has good coverage with Scald
  • Ice Punch is used to deal good damage to Grass and Dragon-types
  • Toxic is Marshtomp's only way past opposing defensive Porygon2 and other bulky threats

Set Details

  • Maximum Defense investment makes Marshtomp as physically bulky as possible
  • A Relaxed Nature is used to preserve Scald's power, as Marshtomp does not need its Speed

Usage Tips

  • Pivot Marshtomp into the Pokemon it checks, such as Rhydon and Monferno
  • Scout for lures such as Freeze-Dry Piloswine or Hidden Power Grass Electabuzz that can hamper Marshtomp's ability to check what it needs to check

Team Options

  • Grass-type checks such as Sliggoo and Fletchinder are good partners for Marshtomp to help with his 4x weakness to Grass. Sliggoo can even check Electric-types that may carry Grass coverage so Marshtomp doesn't have as much pressure put on it
  • Wish users such as Togetic can synergize well with Marshtomp, as it can pass Marshtomp Wishes to increase its longetivity
  • Pokemon that like a good switch-in to physical attackers, like Monferno and Electabuzz, appreciate Marshtomp's capabilities to check these threats

Metang.overview:
• Solid defensive typing and high Defense allow Metang to switch into many physical attackers
  • Deep movepool, including utility moves such as Stealth Rock, Reflect, Light Screen, and STAB priority
  • Forced to run specific attacks, meaning Metang will always be walled by something
  • Unimpressive Attack makes Metang a largely mediocre wallbreaker
  • Low Speed and weaknesses to common offensive types such as Fire and Ground make it easy to revenge kill
Metang.comments:
Other Options

  • An Assault Vest set helps Metang avoid an OHKO from Life Orb Haunter and a 2HKO from Life Orb Electabuzz, although it prevents it from using Stealth Rock, its biggest niche
  • Choice Band can seem appealing at first, although Metang is still quite weak and none of its moves are spammable
  • Agility can be used to make Metang outspeed the entire unboosted tier, although this does not patch up its weaknesses or lack of power
  • Metang has the tools—Reflect, Light Screen and Explosion—to pull off a dedicated lead set on HO teams, although its poor Speed makes it extremely susceptible to Taunt

Checks and Counters

Fire-types: Magmar and Monferno can outspeed and OHKO Metang with their Fire-type STAB attacks

Ground-types: Piloswine and Krokorok deal massive damage to Metang, although the latter fails to OHKO it

Ghost-types: Haunter and Lampent comfortably outspeed and OHKO Metang with STAB Shadow Ball

Burns: Burn status makes Metang's already mediocre Attack plummet and cripples its defensive capabilities

Powerful Special Attackers: Although they do not outright KO a healthy Metang, Electabuzz, Frogadier, and the like are all capable of doing considerable damage and KOing Metang if it has taken chip damage

Bulky Waters: Prinplup and Marshtomp can switch into most of Metang's attacks with ease and threaten it with a Scald burn

sets.name: Offensive Stealth Rock
sets.description:
Moves

  • Stealth Rock can help secure key KOes and is a large part of Metang's niche in Middle Cup
  • Meteor Mash is Metang's most powerful STAB attack and has a helpful twenty-percent chance to raise Attack
  • Earthquake gives Metang near-perfect neutral coverage
  • Zen Headbutt is a secondary STAB move that hits Gurdurr, Golbat, and others super effectively
  • Bullet Punch can be used for revenge killing and cleaning purposes
  • Pursuit is another option to punish Pokemon that Metang forces out

Set Details

  • An Adamant nature and the given EVs maximize Metang's Attack while contributing to its considerable bulk
  • Leftovers provides passive recovery so it can sponge more attacks throughout a match

Usage Tips

  • Pivot Metang into resisted and even weaker neutral attacks freely
  • Use it to weaken walls and soften teammates's checks early and often
  • Metang can get Stealth Rock up throughout a match due to its bulk and favorable match-up against hazard removers
  • Do not keep it in against powerful special attackers unless it is completely healthy

Team Options

  • Switch ins to threatening Fire- and Ground-types, such as Prinplup and Togetic are necessary
  • Pokemon such as Gurdurr that appreciate Fairy- and Flying-types being eliminated
  • Late-game cleaners and sweepers such as Fletchinder that appreciate Stealth Rock support

Monferno.overview:
• Has good offensive stats, letting it play the role of wallbreaker or sweeper effectively
  • Is very frail
  • Can be easily revenge killed by faster Pokemon if it's not holding a Choice Scarf. Even if Monferno uses a Choice Scarf, Fletchinder and other priority users can get around it.
Monferno.comments:
Other Options

  • Nasty Plot can be used to boost Special Attack and turn Monferno into a dangerous special sweeper, but the majority of Monferno's moves have shaky accuracy, and are thus a liability
  • A Choice Band set can be used for more power than Life Orb and with no recoil from Life Orb, but being locked into a move is bad for Monferno, as it likes to switch moves
  • A Stealth Rock + 3 attacks Life Orb set is viable due to Monferno's ability for force switches
  • A Choice Scarf allows Monferno to function as a fast pivot and revenge killer but will reduce its power and is therefore not ideal

Checks and Counters

Faster Pokemon: Monferno, while having a good speed tier, can be revenged by Pokemon that are faster than it, such as Electabuzz and Frogadier

Physical Walls: Non-Swords Dance sets of Monferno can struggle to get through physically defensive Pokemon such as Togetic, although some physically defensive Pokemon, such as Porygon2, are scared out by Monferno

Fletchinder: Fletchinder checks every Monferno set due to revenge killing it easily with priority Acrobatics, but cannot switch in

Gabite: Gabite can wear Monferno down by Rough Skin and/or Rocky Helmet due to its ability to tank Close Combat and taking little from Mach Punch or Flare Blitz. It cannot take a +2 Close Combat, however

sets.name: All-Out Attacker
sets.description:
Moves

  • Close Combat is Monferno's main STAB move, hitting the majority of Middle Cup for good neutral damage. Also hits Rock- and Normal-types super effectively
  • Flare Blitz is a secondary STAB that hits Grass-types hard and also hits Fairy-types
  • Mach Punch is priority and STAB, lets Monferno be a good revenge killer and late-game cleaner
  • U-turn allows Monferno to pivot into another teammate, conversing momentum
  • Rock Slide can be used to hit Flying-types such as Fletchinder super effectively, and it is also Monferno's only way of hitting Lampent

Set Details

  • Maximum Attack and Speed investment is ideal for an offensive Pokemon like Monferno
  • Life Orb increases his damage output, making him a strong wallbreaker
  • Jolly is preferred for the higher Speed, but Adamant can be used for more power, which is good for Mach Punch

Usage Tips

  • Try to switch Monferno in on resisted attacks by weak attackers, as he is very frail
  • Once Monferno is in, try to wallbreak and hit everything in sight
  • If there's not much Monferno can do to the opposing threat, use U-turn to go into a teammate

Team Options

  • Defensive Pokemon that can check some of the offensive Pokemon Monferno is weak to, like Porygon2 and Roselia
  • Pokemon that appreciate Monferno's wallbreaking, such as Frogadier
  • Fletchinder checks, like Rhydon

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Moves

  • Swords Dance is used to wallbreak and sweep
  • Flare Blitz is STAB that hits Grass-types and Fairies
  • Close Combat is another STAB that hits Rock and Normal types
  • Mach Punch is used to clean up late-game and is powerful when boosted

Set Details

  • It focuses more on sweeping than wallbreaking, but is still a very powerful wallbreaker when boosted
  • Fist Plate is an option over Life Orb since you'll use Close Combat more than Flare Blitz, but the boost from Life Orb benefit both attacks

Usage Tips

  • Try to bring Monferno in safely via Volt Switch, U-turn, or on resisted attacks so he can set up
  • Try to set up Swords Dance on a forced switch or on a defnesive Pokemon incapable of doing anything back to Monferno
  • This set needs Fletchinder gone in order to sweep, so try to have it dealt with before trying to sweep

Team Options

  • Status users to help get Monferno more set-up opportunities, like Porygon2
  • Fletchinder checks, like Prinplup and Rhydon

sets.name: Stealth Rock Lead
sets.description:
Moves

  • Stealth Rock allows Monferno to support its team
  • Taunt helps against opposing leads, and prevents walls from using their supporting moves
  • Endeavor to cripple an opponent once Monferno is at low health
  • Mach Punch is great when used with Endeavor, as it picks off faster threats that have been brought to 1HP

Set Details

  • This set plays much more differently than the other sets, taking a suicidal and supportive role
  • Focus Sash is needed for Monferno to get up Stealth Rock safely
  • The EV spread and nature maximize Speed and Attack while a negative defensive nature helps bring it to Endeavor range
  • Because Monferno should be getting to 1HP as quickly as possible, drop the Defense and Special Defense IVs to 0

Usage Tips

  • Lead with Monferno at the start of the match, as he is a suicide lead
  • Try to set up Stealth Rock as soon as possible, and Taunt any Defog users
  • This set has a good matchup against other leads due to its ability to Taunt them, preventing hazard setup

Team Options

  • This set fits well on offensive teams that appreciate having Stealth Rock early on in the game
  • Teammates that appreciate having Stealth Rock up, such as Frogadier and Doublade, make for good partners

Prinplup.overview:
• Is one of the best Defog users in Middle Cup
  • Has a great typing and good bulk that lets it check many threats like Fletchinder
  • Has access to Stealth Rock
  • Can be overwhelmed by having to check many things, especially with its lack of reliable recovery
  • Is passive, making it setup bait for sweepers like Grovyle and Porygon2
Prinplup.comments:
Other Options

  • An offensive Defog set can be used to give Prinplup more offensive presence, but comes at the sacrifice of it's bulk, preventing it from checking physical threats
  • A Swords Dance set can be used, but is outclassed by Dewott as a physical Water-type and lacks power

Checks and Counters

Sliggoo: While prone to having Stealth Rock set up on it, Sliggoo resists Scald and can cure burns with Rest while setting up Curses

Grass-types: Grass-types resist Scald and can set up or use their Grass STAB on Prinplup. Roselia is noteworthy for it's immunity to Toxic and ability to heal Scald burns with Natural Cure

Electric-types: Electabuzz and other Electric-types can threaten Prinplup with their STAB moves. Guts Luxio takes advantage of Scald burns and immediately threatens back

Wallbreakers: Despite its solid Defense, Prinplup's lack of reliable recovery leaves it vulnerable to powerful wallbreakers like Life Orb Piloswine and Staravia and will be unable to wall such threats

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description:
Moves

  • Defog removes hazards and is the main reason to use Prinplup
  • Stealth Rock supports teammates, as Prinplup beats most other Stealth Rock setters like Rhydon with it's Water STAB and Defog
  • Scald is Prinplup's main STAB move, dealing decent chip damage and can burn opponents as well
  • Toxic cripples walls, which helps with Prinplup's passivity
  • Ice Beam can be used over Toxic as a means of hitting Grass-types and Dragon-types for decent damage, but makes Prinplup's matchup against walls like Porygon2 worse

Set Details

  • Maximum investment in physical defense along with a Bold nature makes Prinplup as bulky as possible
  • Leftovers attempts to patch Prinplup's longevity by gradually restoring HP
  • A specially defensive spread can be used to be a better check to Fire-types like Charmeleon, but is not advised as this prevents Prinplup from checking Fletchinder and other physical threats.

Usage Tips

  • Pivot Prinplup into the Pokemon it can check, like Rhydon and Fletchinder
  • Stealth Rock is a good move to use on forced switches, although Defog is a fine option for removing hazards
  • Prinplup gets worn down very easily, so it's good to not switch it into all of the attacks the opponent pulls at you

Team Options

  • Pokemon that can check Grass- and Electric-types, like Roselia and Fletchinder for Grass-types, and Piloswine and Gabite for Electric-types, make for good partners to Prinplup
  • Fletchinder also appreciates the Defog support Prinplup gives and checks Grass-types for Prinplup, making it a good partner
  • Secondary checks to some of the Pokemon Prinplup checks are not necessary, but are appreciated as Prinplup can get worn down easily by repeated switchins

Gabite.overview:
• Solid Attack and a good Speed tier make Gabite a dependable wallbreaker
  • Great offensive typing with near-perfect neutral coverage
  • Middling bulk and weakness to extremely common Pokemon such as Togetic and Piloswine prevent it from setting Stealth Rock reliably throughout a match
  • Lack of useful setup moves prevents it from breaking through physical walls without chip damage
Gabite.comments:
Other Options

  • Iron Head and Iron Tail can be used over Stone Edge to hit all Fairy-types, but the former is too weak and the latter too unreliable
  • Roar combined with Stealth Rock can help in racking up hazard damage

Checks and Counters

Piloswine: Piloswine's super effective priority is the easiest way to OHKO Gabite

Fairy-types: Togetic is not OHKOed after Stealth Rock damage while nearly OHKOing with Dazzling Gleam, and other Fairy-types such as Floette have a high chance to do so

Powerful Attackers: Life Orb Rhydon OHKOes Gabite with Earthquake, and other very powerful attackers such as Gurdurr deal massive damage

Ice-Type Coverage: Porygon2, Frogadier, and others often run Ice Beam, which OHKOes Gabite, to say nothing of the numerous Pokemon capable of running Hidden Power Ice

sets.name: Offensive Stealth Rock
sets.description:
Moves

  • Stealth Rock racks up valuable chip damage on the opposition
  • Dragon Claw is a dependable STAB attack with phenomenal neutral coverage
  • Earthquake is a powerful STAB move that hits the Steel-types that resist Dragon Claw super effectively
  • Stone Edge is primarily for Togetic, which is immune to both of Gabite's STAB types

Set Details

  • Rough Skin punishes physical attackers and U-turn users
  • A Jolly nature is necessary to outspeed the important base 80 Speed tier and Monferno
  • The EVs are invested in Speed and Attack to maximize Gabite's offensive potential
  • Life Orb makes Gabite an even more powerful wallbreaker

Usage Tips

  • Gabite is capable of threatening out many Pokemon and getting Stealth Rock up for free
  • Use it early and often to punch holes and weaken checks
  • Avoid switching Gabite into neutral attacks, as any damage will be compounded by Life Orb recoil and significantly shorten its lifespan

Team Options

  • Piloswine checks such as Croconaw
  • Fairy-type counters such as Doublade
  • Cleaners like Fletchinder that appreciate Stealth Rock chip damage

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Moves

  • Dragon Claw is a reliably strong STAB attack that still allows Gabite to switch out after use
  • Earthquake is a spammable and very strong STAB move
  • Stone Edge hits Flying-types, and most notably Togetic, super effectively
  • Outrage is Gabite's most powerful physical attack, although it comes at the cost of being locked into it and confusion
  • Fire Blast is another option that 2HKOes Quilladin, which otherwise walls this set

Set Details

  • Choice Scarf and a Jolly nature allow Gabite to outspeed many of the tier's common Speed boosters such as Scarf Krokorok and Rock Polish Rhydon
  • Rough Skin gets chip damage on physical attackers
  • The given EVs maximize Gabite's speed and power

Usage Tips

  • As a cleaner, reserve Scarf Gabite for the late-game when its checks and counters have been weakened or dealt with
  • Avoid clicking Outrage unless KOes are guaranteed, as the free turns it affords otherwise can be very costly
  • Gabite can also be a very effective revenge killer, especially against offensive teams

Team Options

  • Golbat and other Pokemon capable of switching into Fairy-types
  • Gurdurr and other physical wallbreakers that can soften Gabite's checks
  • Hazard setters like Roselia to cripple walls

Servine.overview:
• A middling special attacker in an offensive metagame
  • Has access to Glare, which gives it a niche in supporting slower teammates
  • Matches up poorly against most offensive threats
Servine.comments:
Other Options

  • Servine has various setup moves such as Coil and Calm Mind that could be utilized, but it lacks the movepool and power necessary to pull it off
  • Aromatherapy allows Servine to act as a cleric for teammates vulnerable to paralysis and burn status; faces competition from other clerics such as Togetic due to their superior bulk and defensive typing
  • Servine could run a SubSeed set; however, this can be hard to use successfully in an overwhelmingly offensive metagame

Checks and Counters

Roselia: Roselia completely walls Servine and has Natural Cure to heal off paralysis

Sliggoo: Sliggoo is immune to Servine's STAB moves, doesn't take much from a Hidden Power Ice or Knock Off, and can use Sludge Wave to hit Servine super effectively

Golbat: Despite being weak to Hidden Power Rock, Golbat is only 3HKOed by the move and immediately threatens Servine back with Brave Bird

Fire-types: Magmar and Charmeleon are not OHKOed by Hidden Power Rock and will threaten back with super effective STAB moves

sets.name: Offensive Glare
sets.description:
Moves

  • Glare is the main reason to use Servine, as it cripples opponents for other teammates to take advantage of. It also makes Servine very annoying to switch in on
  • Energy Ball is Servine's main STAB move, hitting Ground- or Water-types super effectively
  • Leaf Storm is an option over Energy Ball, giving Servine the ability to punch holes through most opposing tanks
  • Hidden Power Rock demolishes Fletchinder, Servine's main switch-in, and other Fire-types while neutrally hitting opposing Grass- and Dragon-types
  • Hidden Power Ground is a good option that allows Servine to hit Steel- or Fire-types, but leaves Servine vulnerable to opposing Flying- or Grass-types
  • Hidden Power Ice is an option to hit Grass-types and Dragon-types, but it leaves Servine vulnerable to Fire and Steel-types
  • Knock Off allows Servine to remove the opponent's item, giving it more utility
  • Taunt allows Servine to prevent opposing hazards from being set up
  • Synthesis gives Servine a recovery move that boosts its longevity

Set Details

  • Maximum Special Attack and Speed investment makes Servine as powerful and fast as possible
  • Meadow Plate powers up Servine's STAB moves, as Life Orb recoil is not optimal for a supportting Pokemon
  • A Modest Nature is chosen over Timid, as Servine really needs the power to thrive in an offensive metagame and already outspeeds the opponent if lands a Glare

Usage Tips

  • Servine should spam Glare on switch-ins, crippling them for the rest of the match unless the opposing team has clerics
  • Try to switch Servine in on resisted attacks, and keep in mind that it can switch into some neutral hits due to its decent bulk

Team Options

  • Slower teammates that can take advantage of paralyzed opponents, such as Piloswine and Monferno, make for good teammates
  • Teammates that can beat Servine's checks and counters, specifically Ice-types for Sliggoo and Roselia, make for good Servine partners
  • Vanillish is an especially good partner, as it can capitalize on Sliggoo and Roselia while appreciating Glare making up for its low Speed

Gurdurr.overview:
• One of the tier's premier wallbreakers and cleaners
  • Very high Attack
  • Solid STAB priority
  • Great coverage in Stone Edge and Knock Off
  • High Defense and power let it counter physical sweepers like Rhydon
  • Extreme slowness and low Special Defense let fast special attackers revenge kill it easily
Gurdurr.comments:
Other Options

  • Choice Band Gurdurr is a very threatening cleaner; however, the power difference from LO is generally not great enough to justify not being able to switch moves
  • Sheer Force can be used over Guts, but most of Gurdurr's best moves are not boosted
  • Poison Jab can be used, although Stone Edge does more damage to Togetic, the most important Fairy-type

Checks and Counters

Flying-types: Fletchinder, Staravia, and others cannot switch into Stone Edge, but they can soft-check Gurdurr with their super effective STAB attacks

Fairy-types: Clefairy and Floette cannot directly switch in on coverage moves, but hit Gurdurr super effectively

Faster Special Attackers: Frogadier and Psychic Electabuzz are the primary examples of special attackers capable of outspeeding and OHKOing Gurdurr, although they are both 2HKOed by Mach Punch

sets.name: Life Orb Attacker
sets.description:
Moves

  • Drain Punch is a reasonably strong STAB attack that also restores health
  • Mach Punch is a powerful priority move backed by Gurdurr's high Attack that helps make up for its poor Speed
  • Stone Edge hits Flying-types super effectively
  • Knock Off hits Psychic-types such as Duosion super effectively
  • Bulk Up gives Gurdurr sweeping potential

Set Details

  • Life Orb boosts Gurdurr's already good Attack to sky-high levels
  • Gurdurr is hopelessly slow, so the EVs and nature focus on power and bulk
  • Guts makes Gurdurr an optimal status absorber and Scald switch-in

Usage Tips

  • Use Gurdurr early and often to soften up walls for a sweep from a teammate
  • Gurdurr can also be used late game to clean up weakened frail threats such as Frogadier with Mach Punch
  • Gurdurr is quite vulnerable to being worn down, so be wary of that in conjunction with Life Orb recoil

Team Options

  • Flying-type counters such as Electabuzz
  • Prinplup and other Frogadier switchins
  • Fairy-type counters like Doublade

Krokorok.overview:
• Decent Attack plus Moxie make Krokorok one of the most common and effective Scarf users in the metagame
  • Has great offensive typing with access to phenomenal STAB moves like Earthquake and Knock Off
  • Is largely dependent on a Choice item to be effective due to mediocre Speed
  • Positively non-existent bulk and poor defensive typing make it extremely vulnerable to priority and many revenge killers
Krokorok.comments:
Other Options

  • Stealth Rock is another utility move in Krokorok's movepool, though there are many more reliable setters
  • Taunt is yet another useful utility move that could allow Krokorok to prevent opposing setup and hazard stacking

Checks and Counters

Physically Bulky Pokemon: Rhydon and Piloswine, although they are hit super effectively by coverage and even by STAB attacks, can comfortably check Krokorok

Grass-types: Quilladin, Grotle, and others resist Earthquake and take little damage from Knock Off, allowing them to counter Krokorok easily

Flying-types: Togetic and Golbat take little damage from either of Krokorok's STAB attacks, although they are susceptible to heavy damage from Stone Edge

Faster Choice Scarf Users: Although rare, Choice Scarf Frogadier and Electabuzz are capable of outspeeding and OHKOing Krokorok, the former with Hydro Pump and the latter with Focus Blast

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Moves

  • Earthquake is Krokorok's most powerful STAB attack
  • Knock Off is a STAB attack with great power, and it gives Krokorok the utility to remove opposing items
  • Stone Edge gives it a way to hit Flying-types super effectively and prevents Togetic from consistently walling it
  • Aqua Tail is useful for hitting Rhydon and Piloswine super effectively; however, it fails to OHKO either
  • Pursuit allows Krokorok to trap Psychic-types that it forces out, preventing them from switching out safely

Set Details

  • Moxie can turn Krokorok into a fearsome cleaner once the correct walls have been eliminated
  • A Jolly nature lets Krokorok outspeed key threats such as +2 Jolly Rhydon and Doublade and +1 Jolly Fraxure
  • The EVs maximize Attack and Speed

Usage Tips

  • On purely offensive teams, Krokorok should be saved for late-game, when its checks have been eliminated
  • Bringing it in too early will result in potentially costly hard-switches
  • On balanced teams, it can be used as a speedy revenge killer and Pursuit trapper provided it has teammates capable of switching into threats such as Gurdurr
  • Avoid switching Krokorok into even resisted attacks due to its extreme frailty

Team Options

  • Slow pivots such as Baton Pass Togetic can bring Krokorok in without forcing it to take a hit
  • Fletchinder and other offensive Flying-types handle the Fighting- and Grass-types that Krokorok struggles to break through
  • Togetic can switch into physical priority users such as Gurdurr and Croconaw that OHKO Krokorok

Fraxure.overview:
• Fraxure has the second highest Attack in the tier combined with respectable base 67 Speed
  • Has decent physical bulk, so it can switch into resisted attacks relatively well
  • One of the best sweepers in the tier because of high Attack and great coverage options
Fraxure.comments:
Other Options

  • Fraxure can potentially run a Choice Band set, making it an instantly devastating wallbreaker
  • Taunt can prevent opposing setup and hazard setting

Checks and Counters

Doublade: Doublade hard counters every Fraxure set other than Swords Dance Life Orb

Piloswine: Not even a Superpower from Fraxure OHKOes Piloswine, while an Ice Shard has a large chance to do so after Stealth Rock damage

Fairy-types: Fraxure has Poison Jab, but it fails to 2HKO physically defensive Togetic, which nearly OHKOes back with even an unboosted, uninvested Dazzling Gleam

Faster Special Attackers: Frogadier, Electabuzz, Seadra, and others do massive damage to Fraxure with their super effective coverage moves

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description:
Moves

  • Dragon Dance boosts Fraxure's Attack and Speed
  • Outrage is Fraxure's most powerful STAB move, but results in Fraxure being locked-in for 2 to 3 turns then confused afterwards
  • Dragon Claw is less powerful but more reliable STAB that doen't lock you in for 2 to 3 turns
  • Poison Jab hits Fairy-types such as Clefairy and Togetic super effectively
  • Aqua Tail decimates Rhydon and gets neutral coverage on Steel-types

Set Details

  • The given EVs with a Jolly nature let Fraxure hit as hard as possible while outspeeding +2 Rhydon and Doublade and Adamant Scarf Krokorok after one Dragon Dance
  • Lum Berry eliminates crippling status and allows Fraxure to use Outrage more freely while Life Orb improves Fraxure's wallbreaking capabilities

Usage Tips

  • Save Fraxure for late in a game, when its checks have been weakened or eliminated
  • Avoid using Outrage unless threats that resist it have been dealt with
  • Life Orb sets should be especially careful to remove priority users, as they tend to do massive damage, especially Piloswine

Team Options

-Fire-types such as Magmar that counter the meta's Steel-types -Clerics that can remove crippling status for non-Lum Berry Fraxure -Fairy-type checks such as Klang and Golbat

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Moves

  • Swords Dance quickly skyrockets Fraxure's Attack stat turning it into a menacing wallbreaker
  • Outrage is Fraxure's most powerful STAB move, destroying most swtich-ins at +2
  • Poison Jab exclusively hits Fairy-types: use Outrage on Grass-types
  • Aqua Tail ensures the OHKO on Rhydon while giving Fraxure something to hit Steel-types with
  • If Doublade proves bothersome, run Night Slash in the last slot, since Aqua Tail is primarily for Rhydon and a +2 Outrage will KO after some chip damage

Set Details

  • EVs and nature maximize Attack and Speed, although an Adamant nature can be used if Croconaw is of no concern to your team
  • A Lum Berry is mandatory for this set: the goal is to spam Outrage and you can't afford to take confusion recoil while at +2. Being able to shrug off status is important too

Usage Tips

  • Swords Dance Fraxure excells in the late game when faster threats have been eliminated and bulkier threats have been weakened
  • A lack of bulk prevents Fraxure from switching in on most attacks, so the use of a pivot to get it in safely is recommened
  • This set doesn't fear Fairy-types: a +2 Poison Jab slaughters all of them after Stealth Rock damage

Team Options

  • This set especially appreciates entry hazard support from Whirlipede, Roselia, or Piloswine, as the combination of Spikes and Stealth Rock chip damage turn the majority of Fraxure's 2HKOs into OHKOs
  • Slow pivots like Togtic recommended
  • Fraxure appreciates having Piloswine and most other strong attackers removed from play before setting up. Pair it with Gurdurr and other similar wallbreakers

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Moves

  • Outrage is Fraxure's most powerful move, and Scarf locks it into a move anyway
  • Poison Jab hits Fairy-types super effectively, although being locked into it is awful
  • Aqua Tail hits Rhydon 4x super effectively but also gets neutral damage on Doublade
  • Superpower allows Fraxure to break through Steel-types that would otherwise wall it

Set Details

  • Choice Scarf immediately raises Fraxure's Speed, making it a phenomenal cleaner
  • The given EVs with a Jolly nature let Fraxure hit as hard as possible while outspeeding +2 Rhydon and Doublade and Adamant Scarf Krokorok

Usage Tips

  • Fraxure cannot clean unless its counters have been completely eliminated
  • Fraxure misses out on many OHKOs when it isn't boosted, so whittling down the opposing team is key
  • Be wary of using Outrage too freely, as confusion is bothersome with no Lum Berry to undo it, and being locked into Poison Jab, as many common Pokemon in the tier resist or are immune to it

Team Options

  • Pokemon such as Seadra and Frogadier that can check Doublade
  • Clerics such as Togetic that can use Heal Bell or Aromatherapy to remove status
  • Pokemon such as Lampent that can counter Fairy-types that prevent Fraxure from spamming Outrage
  • Roselia and other Spikes users, which can rack up vital chip damage

Quilladin.overview:
• Has a unique niche as a physically defensive Grass-type Spikes user
  • Can check threats such as Roselia thanks to Bulletproof
  • Has a very good Defense stat, letting it check threats like Croconaw
  • Has a case of four-moveslot syndrome, as it wants some moves but can't have them all on the same set
  • Passive, making it setup bait for sweepers like Curse Sliggoo
  • Weak to common attacking types such as Ice and Fire
Quilladin.comments:
Other Options

  • An offensive Spikes set can be used for a more offensive presence, but will lose out on Quilladin's great bulk
  • A Belly Drum or Swords Dance set could be used for sweeping, but Quilladin is much more suited to a defensive role
  • Rock Slide is a good option over Zen Headbutt for hitting Fletchinder, but is typically outclassed by Zen Headbutt in all other cases

Checks and Counters

Flying-types: Flying-types like Staravia or Fletchinder resist Quilladin's Grass STAB,can take a Zen Headbutt and will retaliate with their STAB moves. They are also immune to Spikes, which means they won't get worn down by repeated switchins. Golbat, while hurt by Zen Headbutt, is faster than Quilladin and can Defog away its Spikes and can Roost off damage

Fire-types: Fire-types such as Monferno and Braixen can come in on Quilladin's Grass STAB and use their Fire STAB to roast Quilladin. However, Monferno and Pignite do not like taking a Zen Headbutt

Steel-types: Steel-types like Metang and Doublade completely wall Quilladin, and will use it to set up on

Status: Toxic and stray burns reduce Quilladin's staying power in a match by continuously whittling it down. The latter also removes any offensive presence Quilladin was employing

sets.name: Defensive Spiker
sets.description:
Moves

  • Spikes is the obligatory move on this set, helping wear down the opposing team
  • Seed Bomb is the preferred STAB move due to having no recoil and hitting decently hard
  • Wood Hammer is an option in order to score notable OHKOs on Pokemon such as Croconaw, but has nasty recoil
  • Taunt is used to cripple defensive threats like Roselia and Togetic, preventing them from setting up hazards or clearing away Quilladin's hazards with Defog
  • Synthesis is mandatory for reliable recovery, allowing Quilladin to wall most physical threats throughout a match
  • Alternatively, Zen Headbutt allows Quilladin to reliably check and 2HKO Roselia. It also hits other Poison-types such as Golbat, while scoring neutral damage on Fire-, Grass-, Dragon-, or Flying-type switch-ins to Quilladin's Grass-type STAB
  • Roar is an option in order to rack up hazard damage and phaze setup sweepers

Set Details

  • The EV spread allows Quilladin to outspeed minimum speed Roselia and Taunt it; it also allows Quilladin to outspeed other walls such as Sliggoo and Togetic
  • An Impish Nature maximizes Quilladin's defensive potential
  • Bulletproof grants an immunity to moves like Sludge Bomb and Weather Ball, making Quilladin an effective check to Pokemon like Roselia and Weepinbell

Usage Tips

  • Pivot Quilladin into the Pokemon it checks, like Roselia and Croconaw, and proceed to Taunt them, attack, or set up hazards
  • Quilladin is not the best special Water-type check however, due to being crippled by a Scald burn and its weakness to Ice Beam. Use caution when sending it out against Water-types

Team Options

========

  • Checks to Fire- and Flying-type threats, such as Prinplup, Marshtomp, or Rhydon, make for mandatory partners to Quilladin. Palpitoad may seem unconventional, but it checks Fire-types, has Water Absorb to absorb Scald, and can lay Stealth Rock thus forming a hazards core with Quilladin
  • Pokemon that appreciate the Spikes support that Quilladin brings, such as Electabuzz and Monferno, make for excellent teammates
  • Pokemon that can take the special hits that Quilladin cannot take very well, like Porygon2, can make for good partners

Frogadier.overview:
• Fast special attacker with extensive movepool
  • Only naturally outsped by Electabuzz
  • 2HKOs most of the metagame after Stealth Rock damage
  • Frail and easily revenge-killed
Frogadier.comments:
Other Options

  • Taunt can be used to prevent opposing setup, but Frogadier is still beaten by most of Middle Cup's special walls
  • A Toxic Spikes lead set can be used to set up hazards early-game and support Frogadier's teammates, but it is outclassed by Whirlipede and Frogadier is more suited to an offensive role
  • A Choice Scarf set could be run to outspeed every Choice Scarf user besides Electabuzz, but Frogadier loses out on a lot of power and will be forced into the role of a weak pivot

Checks and Counters

Porygon2: Porygon2 stomachs every hit from Frogadier comfortably while threatening back with Thunder Wave, Discharge, and Tri-Attack

Priority: Frogadier is 2HKOed by common priority attacks, such as Mach Punch from Gurdurr after Stealth Rock damage, and may not OHKO Gurdurr in return.

Electabuzz: Electabuzz is the only threat that naturally outspeeds Frogadier and OHKOes it

Choice Scarf Users: All scarfed Pokemon outspeed Frogadier and revenge kill it

Paralysis: If Frogadier ends up paralyzed, it's pretty much useless, as it struggles to take most attacks

sets.name: Life Orb Attacker
sets.description:
Moves

  • Hydro Pump is Frogadier's STAB move of choice, as it provides maximum damage output
  • Ice Beam hits Grass-types such as Roselia for super effective damage and has good coverage alongside Hydro Pump
  • Dark Pulse provides neutral coverage against most of Middle Cup and hits Ghost- and Psychic-types super effectively
  • However, Hidden Power Grass can be used to pick off opposing Water-types, namely Marshtomp, Seadra, or Prinplup
  • U-Turn provides momentum, allowing Frogadier to pivot into another teammate

Set Details

  • Maximum Special Attack and Speed investment is ideal for an offensive Pokemon like Frogadier
  • Life Orb significantly increases Frogadier's damage output, and allows it to switch moves
  • Choice Specs can be utilized in place of Life Orb, earning key OHKOs against Gurdurr and Togetic without the recoil, but at the cost of locking it into one attack

Usage Tips

  • Great offensive lead, as it threatens many common hazard leads and is fast enough to pivot out of bad situations
  • Don't switch this in on anything except resisted attacks from defensive Pokemon; it's too frail to take damage from unboosted attacks

Team Options

  • Electabuzz checks such as Piloswine and Sliggoo work well with Frogadier, as Electabuzz is one of the best offensive checks to Frogadier
  • Entry hazard support: Roselia works especially well, since it resists Electric- and Grass-type attacks
  • Wallbreakers such as Piloswine and Gurdurr help weaken the opposing team so Frogadier can clean up more easily late-game

Sliggoo.overview:
• One of the premier bulky Pokemon in the metagame due to great special bulk, amazing typing, and Sap Sipper
  • Can also perform as a great offensive Pokemon due to its phenomenal movepool
  • Lack of reliable recovery makes Sliggoo prone to getting worn down if it's not running Rest and Sleep Talk
  • Weak to common coverage types, specifically Fairy and Ice
  • Is slow, making it outsped by many offensive Pokemon Has mediocre physical bulk, leaving it open to powerful physical attacks such as Monferno's Close Combat
Sliggoo.comments:
Other Options

  • A Choice Specs set can be used for even more power on the offensive tank set, making Sliggoo an amazingly powerful wallbreaker, but being locked into a move can be undesirable
  • A mixed offensive set with Outrage over Draco Meteor and potentially Iron Tail over Sludge Wave can be used to take advantage from Sap Sipper boosts, and only needs minimal Attack investment to secure an OHKO on Roselia and a 2HKO on Togetic after a boost
  • Ice Beam can be used on the offensive set to attain BoltBeam coverage, but it doesn't hit anything significant other than Roselia

Checks and Counters

Fairy-types: While they have to worried about Sludge Wave and potentially Iron Tail, Fairy-types such as Clefairy and Togetic are still decent checks to Sliggoo as they are immune to its Dragon-type attacks and completely wall the Curse set; Clefairy can even set up Calm Minds on Sliggoo and check Sludge Wave variants due to this

Steel-types: Steel-types like Metang and Klang can check Sliggoo due to being resistant to its STAB moves and only take minimal damage from its coverage. However, Hidden Power Fire variants or repeated switch-ins can wear them down due to them not having reliable recovery

Physical Attackers: While Sliggoo has good special bulk, it doesn't have as good of a Defense stat, making it vulnerable to powerful physical attackers like Monferno. While Curse boosts can help this problem a bit, Sliggoo still has trouble with powerful wallbreakers like Swords Dance Rhydon

Specially Defensive Pokemon: Specially defensive Pokemon such as Porygon2 and Roselia can be a problem for the special attacking set, as they can take a Draco Meteor and heal back up with their recovery moves due to the Special Attack drop from Draco Meteor

sets.name: Offensive Tank
sets.description:
Moves

  • Draco Meteor is Sliggoo's most powerful STAB attack, dealing great damage; however it does have a nasty Special Attack drop after using it
  • Sludge Wave is mandatory to hit Fairy-types like Togetic and Clefairy, while also hitting Grass-types like Quilladin
  • Thunderbolt is used to hit Flying-types such as Fletchinder and hit Water-types like Prinplup for super effective damage
  • Muddy Water can be used to hit Ground-types like Rhydon or Krokorok and Fire-types like Magmar
  • Dragon Pulse is an option over Muddy Water for a more consistent STAB move
  • Hidden Power Fire can be used to hit Steel-types like Klang and Doublade, but it doesn't offer any additional coverage

Set Details

  • Maximum HP investment makes Sliggoo a formidable tank, letting it check Pokemon like as Electabuzz and Magmar
  • Maximum Special Attack investment with a Modest Nature makes Sliggoo quite powerful
  • Sap Sipper is chosen as the ability to grant Sliggoo an immunity to Grass-type attacks
  • Leftovers is the preferred item, helping Sliggoo with its lack of reliable recovery
  • However, Assault Vest is an option to increase Sliggoo's excellent Special Defense, making it a formidable offensive specially defensive tank

Usage Tips

  • Sliggoo should be sent in on the Pokemon it checks, such as Electabuzz
  • Thanks to its coverage and power, Sliggoo can fire off powerful attacks and brutally damage the opposing team while still being decently bulky

Team Options

  • Pokemon that can handle Ice-types such as Piloswine make for good partners to Sliggoo
  • Although Sliggoo has Sludge Wave, a teammate to check Fairy-types is appreciated, as Sliggoo cannot stomach repeated Fairy-type attacks, so Pokemon like Metang and Klang make for good partners
  • Since Sliggoo is slow, a faster teammate that appreciates Sliggoo's wallbreaking capabilities, such as Electabuzz, can capitalize on Sliggoo to help clean up late-game

sets.name: Curse Sweeper
sets.description:
Moves

  • Curse is the crux of this set, making Sliggoo into a scary setup sweeper
  • Rest is used to increase Sliggoo's longevity, making its role as a sweeper more reliable
  • Sleep Talk prevents Sliggoo from being completely vulnerable while sleeping
  • Outrage, while easy to check due to being a lock-in move, is Sliggoo's only physical STAB move, and it's still effective at dealing damage, even when unboosted

Set Details

  • Maximum HP and Special Defense investment along with a Careful Nature make Sliggoo as specially bulky as possible
  • Sap Sipper is used so Sliggoo can switch into Grass-type moves for free, boosting its Attack in the process

Usage Tips

  • Do not attempt to sweep with Sliggoo until Fairy-types are removed and Steel-types are weakened or removed, as they impede its sweep T- hanks to RestTalk, Sliggoo can more effectively check the Pokemon it should, like Magmar, and more comfortably use them as setup bait

Team Options

  • Since this set is completely walled by Fairy-types, Fairy-type checks such as Metang, Doublade, and Nidorino make for mandatory partners to Sliggoo
  • Checks to Steel-types, such as Monferno and Gurdurr, are also appreciated, as this set struggles to get through them
  • Even with Defense boosts from Curse, Sliggoo appreciates being paired with checks to powerful physical attackers, such as Marshtomp and Dusclops, as they synergize well with Curse Sliggoo and relieve the pressure of physical attackers
